RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 54. Maiden Special Weight Purse 31800. FOR ACCREDITED OHIO BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SPUNKY ONE settled in hand just off the leaders down the backside while four wide in the clear, steadily advanced through the turn to engage the pacesetter in mid-stretch and wore that one down in the drive determinedly. IT'S E Z sped off to open a clear advantage shortly from the gate, responded when engaged by the winner but could not hold that one off in a good effort. WINGS OF HEAVEN stalked the pace from the fence to be in striking distance at the head of the lane and failed to mount a closing rally. HOT PRINCESS prompted the pace to the quarter pole and weakened in the stretch. WINDY DANCER broke a step slow, shied from outside rival leaving the gate to drift well into the gap, was straightened away and galloped home.

ENTRY.NAME: Windy Dancer
ENTRY.OWNER: Spicer, Richard and Spitler, D. William
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke slow, shied, drifted in, galloped home

ENTRY.NAME: Spunky One
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled in hand, steady advance 4w, wore rival down

ENTRY.NAME: It's E Z
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed, clear lead, caught, good effort

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 40. Maiden Special Weight Purse 31800. FOR ACCREDITED OHIO BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HISTORYINTHEMAKING reserved off the early pace, made a steady rally in a long drive from four wide through the turn to engage the leader turning for home, dueled with the runner-up down the stretch and edged away late to prevail. LIGHTENING LOTTIE stalked the pace from three wide, assumed command midway around the bend, battled with the winner through the lane and was out-finished in the final yards in a game effort. COWGIRLS HUMOR prompted the early pace from three wide into the turn, dropped back on the bend losing position and finished evenly to gain the show. RIVER HUSTLER trailed most of the way as a non-threat. SOMETHING LUCKY rushed up the inside to take the lead shortly from the gate, set the pace for to the five-sixteenths pole and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Something Lucky
ENTRY.OWNER: Doering Mark Doering David and Doering Rebecca
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed up inside, set pace, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Lightening Lottie
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, assumed command, battled, second best

ENTRY.NAME: Historyinthemaking
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved, rally 4 wide, long drive, duel stretch, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: River Hustler
ENTRY.OWNER: Weaver Paula K and Cline Robert C

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 82. Allowance Purse 25900. FOR TWO YEAR OLDS WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 122 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 28 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances) (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: YOU BET A FORTUNE broke alertly to take command from the gate, set a well measured pace, repelled the challenge of the runner-up turning or home and drew clear in the lane while wandering about. POKER PARTNER bobbled at the start, quickly recovered ranging up to press the pace, made a bold bid nearing the quarter pole but failed to sustain his rally in the stretch. LUCKY COUGAR stalked the pacesetters to be well positioned in the turn and failed to mount a closing rally. EL BAMBINO tracked the leaders from the inside and lacked a closing response. ROYALLY FLUSHED trailed most of the way and showed mild late interest. MOONLIGHT JOKER was one-paced and never threatened.

ENTRY.NAME: You Bet a Fortune
ENTRY.OWNER: Bernardini Jay P Burnsworth Richard and Buyea Kristina
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke alertly, well rated, repelled challenge, clear

ENTRY.NAME: Poker Partner
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled start, pressed pace, bid, not enough, second best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 4 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 94. Claiming Purse 15400. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 28 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BEACH FRONT stalked the leaders to the turn, ranged up four wide on the bend to engage the leader leaving the quarter pole, angled in through the lane while dueling down the stretch and prevailed late in the drive. WOODLAND WALK pressed the early pace, assumed command on the turn, dueled with the winner the length of the stretch while put in tight quarters along the fence and was out-finished in the final strides. GILLIGAN set a pressured pace to midway on the turn, could not go with the top pair but kept on through the lane to hold the show. SAVVY LAYLA broke a step slow to be at the back, tracked the leaders through the turn and lacked a closing response. LOST IN MANHATTAN was outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: Woodland Walk
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, assumed command, battled, in tight

ENTRY.NAME: Beach Front
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, circled 4w, dueled stretch, angled in, prevailed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 5 1M Dirt CR: 54. Claiming Purse 19400. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 28 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GOOD MUSIC hopped at the start, immediately settled into stride, caught wide through the first turn, steadily gained ground to take command turning for home and finished willingly as clearly the best. WHISKEY HELPS slow early to be well at the rear for the first half mile, rallied in the final bend while being committed to be nine wide and finished well to take the place. NO MAS CERVEZA showed speed to take the lead through the first turn, settled into a stalking position down the backside, was set to a drive nearing the quarter pole to threaten and continued to grind down the lane. HARSH TRUTH reserved off the pace in mid-pack to the far turn, rallied coming for home while fanned eight wide and came home evenly. BUCKEYE CHARLIE tracked the leaders through the final turn to be well placed at the head of the lane and had no closing punch. SWEET JILL'S JACK set the pace down the backside on a clear lead and weakened turning for home. THE GOSPEL OF MARK was never a threat.

ENTRY.NAME: No Mas Cerveza
ENTRY.COMMENT: early speed, settled off, bid turn, grinding

ENTRY.NAME: Buckeye Charlie
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leaders, well placed, no punch

ENTRY.NAME: Good Music
ENTRY.COMMENT: hopped start, wide 1st turn, steady advance, clear best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 12200. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 28 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: IRON BERTIE took command leaving the gate, set a well measured pace, responded when called upon turning for home and pulled clear in the stretch. FALL CAMPAIGN stalked the pace from the on-set, lost ground in the bend and kept coming in a determined drive to be second best. BIG BANG BLUE tracked the leaders from four wide into the turn, made a bid to engage the pacesetter at the quarter pole and failed to sustain the rally in the stretch. ENCHANTED MELODY reserved off the pace in mid-pack racing between rivals and rallied mildly late in the lane. DULCE VICTORIA was well placed in contention through the turn and kept on through the stretch without menacing. ROSE KNOWS shuffled at the start to trail the field, circled the field to gain position down the backside and finished with interest. PURDY PUMKIN unhurried early, made steady gains to mid-stretch and flattened out late in the drive. POLITICAL ASTRAY slow early to be at the rear of the field, circled nine wide turning for home and passed tiring rivals. VAVITE tracked the leaders to the quarter pole and lacked a closing kick. MYRA FLEENER was never a threat. LORI'S EYES pressed the pace to the turn and gave way. MOON PARTY steadily faded to be no factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Political Astray
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, circled 9 wide, passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.NAME: Enchanted Melody
ENTRY.OWNER: R and P Racing Stables, LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Big Bang Blue
ENTRY.OWNER: Burnsworth Richard Buyea Kristina and Navy Chief's Racing Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 4 wide, bid turn, failed to sustain

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 7 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 95. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 27500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR OHIO BRED OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR ENTERED TO BE CLAIMED FOR $25,000. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Sin ce November 28 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HUNTER SCOTT stalked the pace through the far turn, saved ground while rallying turning for home, opened a clear advantage in upper stretch and finished in a determined drive to prevail. STAR HAWK tracked the pace from the rail to the far turn, angled around the leaders to mount a closing bid and finished well through the lane. ZERO GRAVITY shuffled at the start to give the field several lengths, trailed to the far turn and launched a belated rally in a good effort having been hampered at the beginning. BIG TRUCK well placed throughout in striking distance, circled three wide to loom boldly turning for home and was out-kicked in the stretch. STRIKE APPEAL failed to menace. COME SEE ABOUT IT raced up from between horses making a middle move down the backstretch to be prominent and flattened out turning for home. DISCLOSURE was not a threat. GOING IN STYLE set the pace through the turn and gave way in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Star Hawk
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, angled around, closed well

ENTRY.NAME: Going in Style
ENTRY.OWNER: Lion Palm Racing Stable and Sixth Gear LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, clear lead, came up empty

ENTRY.NAME: Zero Gravity
ENTRY.COMMENT: shuffled start, trailed, belated rally, good try

ENTRY.NAME: Disclosure
ENTRY.OWNER: Lion Palm Racing Stable and Sixth Gear LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Hunter Scott
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, saved ground, determined drive

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 8 6F Dirt CR: 74. Allowance Purse 36200. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 28 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowa nces).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: THE PINK Z pressed the pace throughout, engaged the leader at the head of the lane, battled with that one to the wire and prevailed in the final strides. OUR BUCKWHEAT set the pace under constant pressure, responded when called upon turning for home, dueled the length of the stretch with the winner from between horses late and just missed. TEAM LEYENDECKER tracked the pace from the inside to the quarter pole, chased the leaders down the lane, angled to the inside of the top pair and was gaining in the final stride to come up just short. HITE reserved off the pace to the head of the stretch and lacked a closing kick. KNOCK WOOD bobbled start and never menaced from there. WETZEL stalked the pace for a half mile and flattened out. DASH OF FIRE trailed and never posed a threat.

ENTRY.NAME: Our Buckwheat
ENTRY.OWNER: Blue Snow Racing Stables and Boots N Bikinis LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace, dueled stretch, outnodded, gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Team Leyendecker
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, stretch rally, angled in, gaining

ENTRY.NAME: Wetzel
ENTRY.OWNER: Pickerrell William D Pickerrell Joe and Cline Robert C

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 9 6F Dirt CR: 79. Allowance Purse 33700. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 28 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In WeightAllowanc es).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: G T THREE FIFTY set a pressured pace to the top of the lane, shook clear when called upon and drew away convincingly. C V JERSEY BEE stalked the pace into the turn, ranged up to challenge at the quarter pole, could not go with the winner and chased that one down the lane as second best. YIPPEE KI YAY tracked the leaders to the bend, rallied three wide to loom up turning for home and flattened out in the stretch. CONSTITUTION COAL well placed along the inside to contend and lacked a closing bid. HOTROD BOBBY failed to menace. RAY'S EMPIRE passed weaker rivals in the lane as a non-threat. FAST CLIP showed brief speed and was through early. I STRONG was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: G T Three Fifty
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace, shook clear, convincingly

ENTRY.NAME: Hotrod Bobby
ENTRY.OWNER: DaCosta Jason and Rowe Robert A

ENTRY.NAME: Yippee Ki Yay
ENTRY.OWNER: Klein Jr Samuel and Kuntz Mark D
